docs.title: Icons
docs.text: For more icons, take a look here: https://github.com/topics/icons

docs.title: fakedata
docs.text: Generate different types of data. Install using haskellstack; other languages has also this library (Ruby, C++, JavaScript, python, Go, etc.).

docs.title: Software
docs.text:
CLI software is easiest installed using your package manager. Homebrew can even install most GUI software for your macOS.

macOSWindowsLinux

Using Terminal:

$ brew search <name>       # look after software 
$ brew install <name>      # install software 
$ brew cask install <name> # install GUI software

See tldr brew for more information.

Using WSL (Ubuntu):

$ apt search <name>         # look after software
$ sudo apt install <name>   # install software

See tldr apt for more information.

pacman/Rosetta

docs.title: Windows Subsystem for Linux
docs.text: Use Linux inside Windows. Works as a package manager for CLI software on Windows.

docs.title: FreeCAD
docs.text: Parametric 3D modeller software. Functionality is assumed to increase a lot the following years.

docs.title: Inkscape
docs.text: Vector graphics editor with bitmap tracing, path effects, filters and generator extensions (QR codes, charts, plots, calendars, etc.).

docs.title: Krita
docs.text: Raster graphics drawing editor with good graphics table support and G'MIC filters.

docs.title: GIMP
docs.text: Raster graphics editor for image manipulation and editing, typically photos.

docs.title: FontForge
docs.text: Font editor software. Can also extract and export fonts from PDF files.

docs.title: ImageMagick
docs.text:
CLI image format converter and editor. (1)

  1. Install using your package manager.

docs.title: EagleAnimation
docs.text: Create stop motion animation, typically using a connected USB-webcam.

docs.title: FFmpeg
docs.text:
CLI to convert video and sound formats. (1)

  1. Install using your package manager.

docs.title: yt-dlp
docs.text:
CLI to download videos and audio from internet (YouTube, Vimeo, etc). (1)

  1. Install using your package manager.

docs.title: GitHub Pages
docs.text: A free and easy way to create a homepage using your GitHub account.

docs.title: Material for MkDocs
docs.text: A popular theme for MkDocs to build webpages. Works well with GitHub pages.

docs.title: awesome-selfhosted
docs.text: List of self hosting alternatives for web services.

docs.title: Pandoc
docs.text:
CLI for converting between text document formats. (1) Makes it easy to create PDF files from Markdown with images, reference system, etc. Templates let you define custom visual styles.

  1. Install using your package manager.

docs.title: LibreOffice
docs.text: Traditional office suite (word processor, spreadsheet, presentation program, database).

docs.title: GitHub
docs.text: The open source central on the internets. Create a user and start development and collaboration.

docs.title: Icons
docs.text: For more icons, take a look here: https://github.com/topics/icons
